# setDestination(_:allowOverwrite:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the destination path of the downloaded file.

## Declaration

```swift
func setDestination(_ path: String, allowOverwrite: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **path**: The path for the downloaded file.
- **allowOverwrite**: [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if an existing file at `path` can be replaced, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Discussion

If `allowOverwrite` is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] and a file already exists at `path`, a unique filename will be created for the downloaded file by appending a number to the filename. The delegate can implement the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSURLDownloadDelegate/download(_:didCreateDestination:)] delegate method to determine the filename used when the file is written to disk.

### Special Considerations

An `NSURLDownload` instance ignores multiple calls to this method.

## Related Documentation

- **download(_:decideDestinationWithSuggestedFilename:)**: The delegate receives this message when `download` has determined a suggested filename for the downloaded file.
- **download(_:didCreateDestination:)**: Sent when the destination file is created.

## Creating and configuring a download instance

- **init(request:delegate:)**: Returns an initialized URL download for a URL request and begins to download the data for the request.
